metadata.title: CVE-2017-14970 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In lib/ofp-util.c in Open vSwitch (OvS) before 2.8.1, there are multiplememory leaks while parsing malformed OpenFlow group mod messages. NOTE: thevendor disputes the relevance of this report, stating "it can only betriggered by an OpenFlow controller, but OpenFlow controllers have muchmore direct and powerful ways to force Open vSwitch to allocate memory,such as by inserting flows into the flow table."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-pki - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-switch - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-test - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-vtep - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
ovn-central - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
ovn-common - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
ovn-controller-vtep - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
ovn-host - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
python-openvswitch - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
python3-openvswitch - 2.9.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.0-0ubuntu1').
